bioghist.p: Lucy Taxis Shoe Meritt (1906-2003) was an archeologist, scholar, teacher, and editor. She received her bachelor's degree from Bryn Mawr College in 1927, her master's in 1928 and her doctorate in 1935. From 1929 to 1934, she studied at the American School of Classical Studies in Athens. During those years she visited many classical sites in Greece and Asia Minor and made the drawings of the mouldings that appeared in her book, Profiles of Greek Mouldings, published in 1936. She taught at Mount Holyoke College from 1937-1950. As a Fellow at the American Academy in Rome in 1937 and 1950, she investigated architectural mouldings in Italy. Her research was later published in two volumes, Profiles of Western Greek Mouldings (1952) and Etruscan and Republican Roman Mouldings (1965). When the American School of Classical Studies in Athens established a publications office at Princeton, she was named Editor of Publications, a post she held from 1950-1972. In 1972 Dr. Meritt returned to the family home in Austin, Texas and was a Visiting Scholar in the Department of Classics at the University of Texas at Austin from 1973 until her death.

scopecontent.p: This collection consists of the personal and professional papers of Lucy T. Shoe Meritt, dating from 1898 to 2003. Records include: correspondence with family members, other scholars and personal friends, including Rhys Carpenter, Homer A. Thompson, Francis Henry Bacon, Katherine Donaldson and Dorothy Kent Hill; publications, reviews, and lectures; records from her work at the American School of Classical Studies at Athens; high school and college notebooks, academic reports, and diplomas; photographs of family members, colleagues, architectural sites, and artifacts; and diaries and travel journals.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
